sen.j: 新嘗祭（にいなめのまつり、にいなめさい、しんじょうさい）とは、11月23日に、天皇が五穀の新穀を天神地祇（てんじんちぎ）に勧め、また、自らもこれを食して、その年の収穫を感謝する祭儀。
sen.e: Niinamesai (Niiname no matsuri, Shinjosai) is a ritual held on 23rd November each year at which the Emperor offers newly harvested rice to the deities of heaven and earth, eats it and expresses gratitude for harvest.

Niinamesai (Niiname no matsuri, Shinjosai) is a ritual held each November 23rd, in which the Emperor offers newly harvested rice to the deities of heaven and earth, eats it and expresses gratitude for the harvest.

sen.j: 宮中三殿の近くにある神嘉殿にて執り行われる。
sen.e: It is held at Shinka-den shrine located near to Kyuchu- sanden (the Three Shrines in the Imperial Court).
It is held at Shinka-den Shrine, which is located near to Kyuchu-sanden (the Three Shrines in the Imperial Court).

sen.j: 秋に新穀を供えて神を祭る稲作儀礼である。
sen.e: It is a ritual of rice-farming held in autumn at which the Emperor worships deities with offering newly harvested rice.
It is a ritual of rice farming held in the autumn, at which the Emperor worships deities by offering newly harvested rice.

sen.j: 飛鳥時代の皇極天皇の御代に始められたと伝えられている。
sen.e: It has been passed down that Niinamesai was firstly held in the Asuka period when The Emperor Kogyoku was on the throne.
It has been passed down that Niinamesai was first held in the Asuka period, during the reign of Emperor Kogyoku.

sen.j: 一時中断されたが、元禄時代の東山天皇の在位中に復活した。
sen.e: Though suspended for some time, it was revived in the Genroku era when the Emperor Higashiyama was on the throne.
Though suspended for some time, it was revived in the Genroku era during the reign of Emperor Higashiyama.

sen.j: 1873年の太陽暦採用以前は旧暦の11月 (旧暦)の2回目の卯の日に行われていた。
sen.e: It had been held on the second U no hi (the day of rabbit) in November (lunar calendar) until the solar calendar was adopted in 1873.
Prior to the adoption of the solar calendar in 1873, it was customarily held on the second U no hi (day of the rabbit) in November (lunar calendar).

sen.j: 1873年から1947年までは祝祭日となっていた。
sen.e: The day of Niinamesai was a national holiday during the period from 1873 to 1947.

sen.j: 戦後は、勤労感謝の日として国民の祝日となった。
sen.e: After the World war Ⅱ, November 23rd was designated as a national holiday named Labor Thanksgiving Day.
After World War Ⅱ, November 23rd was designated as a national holiday called Labor Thanksgiving Day.

sen.j: 新嘗祭自体は伊勢神宮及びそれに連なる神社の祭儀となり、伊勢神宮には天皇の勅使が遣わされて、大御饌（おおみけ：神が召し上がる食事）を供える形式となった。
sen.e: Since then, Niinamesai itself has become the ritual of Ise-jingu Shrine and its related shrines and on the day, the Emperor's messenger is dispatched to Ise-jingu Shrine and offers Oomike (food for deities).
